column1: #Text=Image : The White House .
#Text=Why are you a Democrat ?
#Text=I have always considered myself to be a Democrat , although what that term means has shifted over the years .
#Text=I probably best fit the term " Kennedy Democrat " because I am a strong advocate of social equality and freedom but I believe we must be fiscally responsible as well .

column3:
_	_	_	_

5-10	396-397

column1: #Text=While that may not fit the current narrative of modern liberalism that favors social justice and a mixed economy leaning toward an ever increasing presence of government regulation and assistance , it reflects what I truly believe .
#Text=I think , during the modern era , Democrats have been the primary political catalyst for social equality and change .

#Text=President Kennedy had a unique ability to bring both sides of the aisle together to [ make ] progress in that regard , but he also recognized that government regulation bore a cost and could pose a threat if it was used in an unbridled fashion .
#Text=We seem to have forgotten that concept .
#Text=Conservatives are relatively adverse to change .
#Text=I am not .
#Text=I simply think change needs to [ be ] achieved in a responsible manner and that federal officials should recognize their [ responsibility ] to serve as stewards of the taxpayers ' money .
#Text=I also think we need to figure out how to provide more opportunities for people rather than just mask the symptoms with assistance .
#Text=The goal of government assistance should always be to provide it as a temporary bridge rather than a permanent foundation .
#Text=When we lose sight of this , we create programs that deepen our problems rather than resolve them .
#Text=I clearly do n't fit the Republican mindset when it comes to my position on social issues .
#Text=However , I 'm sure I cause discomfort for some Democrats who think that the government is the solution to every problem .

#Text=My real world experience in business and my exposure to the economies of other countries have given me a different perspective ; one that compels me to assess government programs from a rational basis as well as an emotional one .
#Text=I think there 's room in the Democratic Party for that type of mindset .
#Text=Campaign
#Text=What do you hope to accomplish with this campaign ?
#Text=Well , imagine if I were to win .
#Text=If I win , " We all Win " . . . " America Wins " . . . and the World would be a better place .
#Text=What I know I can achieve is to broaden the active Democratic base .
#Text=The Hispanic community in this country has been relatively inactive from a political perspective .
#Text=While it represents a sizable element of the Party 's foundation , it is somewhat underrepresented in elected office and does not participate in the electoral process to the degree it should .
#Text=I can spotlight the importance of registering to vote and participating in the process within the Hispanic community because my candidacy has attracted some attention in that regard .
#Text=I hope I will encourage other minorities and underrepresented groups to become more engaged as well .
